DOC.brief_title: Impact Booster Course Antenatal Steroids Neonatal Outcome Patients With Premature Rupture Membranes
DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter randomize double blind trial hope prospectively evaluate impact one versus two course antenatal steroid incidence major neonatal morbidity include respiratory distress syndrome pregnant woman singleton gestation 24w0d - 32w6d gestation document premature rupture membrane .
DOC.criteria: Participants age 18 year old 24w0d 32w6d week gestation Singleton pregnancy Received first course ACS prior 31w6d gestation Began first course ACS least 7 day ( =/ > 168 hour ) prior randomization Expectant management plan Premature Ruptured membrane ( PROM ) onset labor Known major fetal anomaly Multiple gestation Not candidate expectant management Clinical chorioamnionitis ( two follow : temperature > 38.0 degree centigrade ; uterine tenderness ; foul smell vaginal discharge amniotic fluid ; maternal tachycardia > 100 bpm ; fetal tachycardia > 160 bpm ; maternal White Blood Cell ( WBC ) count > 20 X 109/L ; CReactive Protein ( CRP ) > 5.9 Already receive corticosteroid another condition Any contraindication maternal use corticosteroid
